benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/catalog/xml - Upload the full catalog as XML

covered: POST - Valid Payload scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05, TC13, TC24, TC26, TC27, TC29, TC30, TC31) yield HTTP 201 and include a resource URL in Location header; confirm resource availability.
POST - Invalid Payload scenarios (TC08, TC09, TC10, TC17, TC18, TC23) verify HTTP 400/422 and meaningful error messages for malformed, empty, or unsafe payloads.
POST - Duplicate Submission (TC25) confirms behavior for duplicate catalog versions (201 or 409).
POST - Large Payloads (TC12) validates handling of large payloads and system limits.
POST - Server Error Handling (TC16) validates 503 response when backend service is down.
POST - Authorization (TC14) validates handling of invalid/missing authentication with 401/403 responses.
Performance Scenarios (TC19, TC20) validate responsiveness under load.
Regression Scenarios (TC21, TC22) validate backward compatibility and bug fixes.
Edge Cases (TC11, TC28, TC29, TC30, TC31) cover extra headers, encoding/CDATA, boundary values, accessibility.
gaps: Rate Limiting: No explicit tests for rate limiting/throttling on POST /1.0/kb/catalog/xml.
Caching Behavior: No tests verifying caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) on POST responses.
Internal Server Error: No explicit 500 Internal Server Error scenario (DB failures) beyond 503.
Header Value Validation: No tests targeted at length/allowed-character validation for X-Killbill-CreatedBy or other header values.
Content-Type Variants: Limited content-type testing; additional valid alternatives like text/xml or application/xml are not explicitly covered.
Additional security edge cases: While XXE/malicious payload tested (TC17), broader security checks could be expanded.
recommendations: Add a 500 Internal Server Error test to simulate database/microservice failures and ensure 500 responses are handled gracefully.
Add rate-limiting/throttling tests to ensure system robustness under bursts of POST requests.
Add caching validation tests by asserting presence and correctness of ETag/Cache-Control headers on POST responses where applicable.
Enhance header-value validation tests to include boundary lengths and disallowed characters for X-Killbill-CreatedBy, Reason, and Comment headers.
Test additional content-type variations (text/xml, application/xml) to ensure proper handling and content negotiation.
Consider explicit tests for duplicate submissions over rapid sequences (400/409 variations) to define idempotency expectations.
Add more boundary and encoding tests (e.g., UTF-32, mixed encodings, extremely long lines) to stress XML parsing.
Expand accessibility tests to include automated checks for screen-reader friendliness and semantic clarity in response bodies where applicable.
